definition: to vouch for/to guarantee
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: I can vouch for the accuracy of my information.
sentences.chinese: 我敢打保票，我的消息很可靠。

sentences.english: You said today's class is cancelled at the last moment. Would you like to bet on it?
sentences.chinese: 你說今天的課臨時被取消了。你敢打保票嗎？

sentences.english: I can't promise but I'll do my best.
sentences.chinese: 我可不敢打保票，不過我會盡力的。

sentences.english: I'm also betting he will copy your behavior.
sentences.chinese: 我也敢打保票，他肯定會模仿你的舉止。
